Supports JEPA extension into vision-language world modeling and selective decoding; strong for substrate breadth, indirect for control-plane necessity.

I-JEPA explicitly uses a slowly updated target encoder and fast predictor updates, directly supporting target-anchor stabilization; mapping this to REE E1/E2 timescale separation is strong but still indirect.
The work introduces uncertainty-aware latent modeling and uncertainty-related regularization beyond plain residual minimization, supporting explicit separation of mismatch and uncertainty channels.

V-JEPA2 action-conditioned training includes distinct immediate and rollout loss channels, which supports dual-stream error handling, but these are not explicitly mapped to REE pre-commit versus post-commit accountability semantics.
